pullRequest.body:
Define the type of closed subgroup in a topological group.

### PR summary [51db950ccc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16977/commits/51db950ccc41749b583789f47c9211fe18fdf1da)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Category.ProfiniteGrp.Basic`|1|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.ClosedSubgroup`|922|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ClosedAddSubgroup`
`+ ClosedSubgroup`
`+ instInfClosedSubgroup`
`+ instSemilatticeInfClosedSubgroup`
`+ instance : Coe (ClosedSubgroup G) (Subgroup G)`
`+ instance : SetLike (ClosedSubgroup G) G`
`+ instance : SubgroupClass (ClosedSubgroup G) G`
`+ instance [CompactSpace G] (H : ClosedSubgroup G) : CompactSpace H`
`+ isOpen_of_isClosed_of_finiteIndex`
`+ normalCore_eq_iInf_conjAct`
`+ normalCore_isClosed`
`+ ofClosedSubgroup`
`+ toSubgroup_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
bors d+

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11093081822/job/30818915604)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11093081822/job/30818915523)
Apart from one comment, LGTM, thanks!

```suggestion
/-!
# Closed subgroups of topological groups
```

```suggestion
/-- The type of closed subgroups of a topological group. -/
@[ext]
structure ClosedSubgroup (G : Type u) [Group G] [TopologicalSpace G] extends Subgroup G where
  isClosed' : IsClosed carrier
```

```suggestion
/-- The type of closed subgroups of an additive topological group. -/
@[ext]
structure ClosedAddSubgroup (G : Type u) [AddGroup G] [TopologicalSpace G] extends
    AddSubgroup G where
```

```suggestion

* `finindex_closedSubgroup_isOpen` : A closed subgroup with finite index is open.

```

```suggestion
  ⟨fun U V ↦ ⟨U ⊓ V, U.isClosed'.inter V.isClosed'⟩⟩
```
As by the [style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#anonymous-functions), `↦` is preferred over `=>`. (Similar replacements below)

Please avoid non-terminal unrestricted `simp` calls in the middle of a proof, since these break easily whenever the default `simp` set changes. In this case, just replacing `simp` by `simp only` works.
Could you please make this a separate lemma and move it somewhere close to the definition of `Subgroup.normalCore`?
I didn't find any good place after conjact is defined, could you give some suggestions?
I think right after `Subgroup.smul_normal` in `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Subgroup.Pointwise` would be a good place.
Thank you!

Instead of
```lean
constructor
all_goals intro h
```
you can use
```lean
refine ⟨fun h ↦ ?_, fun h ↦ ?_⟩
```
I think those declarations should be in the `Subgroup` namespace instead, so we can use dot notation on `H`.

```suggestion
@[to_additive]
lemma isOpen_of_isClosed_of_finiteIndex (H : Subgroup G) [H.FiniteIndex]
```
Is there already a `{G : Type*} [Group G]` in scope at this point of the file? If yes, could you please get rid of these in your lemma?
I think it would be useful if this was a standalone instance in the `ClosedSubgroup` file for any `G` with `[CompactSpace G]`.
I draged the instance out side, but that `letI` then `inferInstance` still cannot be deleted, I think that doesn't matters much, but can it be designed better to do so?
Is this correct? Usually both names are the same, when a new file is started.
Sorry that I just copy the file from my repo, maybe I should change it. May I ask you to send it again? Thank you.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Group): define closed subgroup

feat(FieldTheory/Galois): Fundamental theorem of infinite galois theory
